title: How to Get Overwatch Coins in Overwatch 2 (For Free or Purchase)

steps.title: Open your Challenges menu and tab over to Weekly.
steps.content: Open your Challenges menu and tab over to Weekly . Every week, you can get Overwatch Coins by completing a set of weekly challenges. These challenges reset once per week and each one grants 5,000 Battle Pass XP.

steps.title: Look through the weekly challenges.
steps.content: Look through the weekly challenges. Your progress for completing the weekly challenges is shown on the right side of the screen. A total of 60 coins can be obtained each week. Complete 4 weekly challenges to get 30 Overwatch Coins Complete 8 weekly challenges to get 20 Overwatch Coins Complete 11 (all) weekly challenges to get 10 Overwatch coins

steps.title: Sign up for Bing Rewards.
steps.content: Sign up for Bing Rewards . If you use Bing instead of Google for your searches, you can start racking up Bing Rewards points . Each search gets you 5 points, and you can use these points to get various rewardsâ€”including Overwatch Coins. If you already have a Bing Rewards account, sign in with it.

steps.title: Click the Redeem tab on the Rewards dashboard.
steps.content: Click the Redeem tab on the Rewards dashboard. This will show you all of the available rewards you can buy with your Bing Rewards points.

steps.title: Scroll down to find the Overwatch Coins redemption.
steps.content: Scroll down to find the Overwatch Coins redemption. You can redeem 1,800 Bing Points for 200 Overwatch Coins. [1] X Research source That equals out to 360 Bing searches at 5 points a search. Check the fine print at the bottom of the page to see when your rewards codes expire. You can also redeem 10,000 points for 1,000 Overwatch Coins (10 points/coin), but it's a better deal to get 200 coins for 1,800 points (9 points/coin).

steps.title: Redeem your rewards code in Battle.net.
steps.content: Redeem your rewards code in Battle.net. Go to your Account Overview page on Battle.net to redeem the rewards code to get your Overwatch Coins.

steps.title: Go to the Shop tab in-game.
steps.content: Go to the Shop tab in-game. You can purchase Overwatch Coins as well, if earning them for free is not going as quickly as you want.

steps.title: Purchase an Overwatch Coin pack.
steps.content: Purchase an Overwatch Coin pack. You can also purchase Overwatch Coins in the Battle.net client or on the Battle.net website . You can buy Overwatch Coins for the following amounts: 500 coins for $4.99 1,000 coins for $9.99 2,200 coins for $19.99 5,700 coins for $49.99 11,600 coins for $99.99

steps.title: Watch for Twitch Drops.
steps.content: Watch for Twitch Drops. Blizzard doesn't typically give out Overwatch Coins for Twitch Drops, but if you're looking for more cosmetics (the main thing you can buy with Overwatch Coins) you can get them by watching participating Twitch streams when a drop is going on. [2] X Research source Watch the Overwatch site or follow Overwatch on Twitter/X to know when the next Twitch Drops are live.
